questions.prompt: What is the primary purpose of a type system?
options: To prevent certain kinds of errors
questions.explanation: Type systems prevent type errors by ensuring operations are applied to appropriate values.

questions.prompt: When are types checked in a statically-typed language?
questions.explanation: Static typing checks types at compile time, catching errors before the program runs.
Python uses dynamic typing where type checking occurs at runtime rather than compile time.

options: Automatic deduction of types by the compiler
questions.explanation: Type inference allows the compiler to deduce types automatically without explicit annotations.

options: Types are checked at compile time
questions.explanation: Strong typing restricts implicit type conversions, requiring explicit conversion between incompatible types.

options: Functions that work on multiple types uniformly
questions.explanation: Parametric polymorphism allows functions to work uniformly over any type, using type parameters (generics).

questions.prompt: What is an algebraic data type?
options: A composite type formed by sum and product types
questions.explanation: ADTs combine sum types (variants/enums) and product types (tuples/records) to model data structures.

questions.prompt: What is the Hindley-Milner type system known for?
questions.explanation: Hindley-Milner provides complete, decidable type inference with principal types, used in ML and Haskell.

options: A subtype can be used where a supertype is expected
Types that are smaller in memory
questions.explanation: Subtype polymorphism (Liskov substitution) allows a subtype to be used wherever its supertype is expected.

options: Types that can depend on values
questions.explanation: Dependent types allow types to depend on values, enabling more expressive type-level programming.
Type soundness guarantees that well-typed programs won't encounter type errors at runtime (won't get stuck).

questions.prompt: What are the two properties that prove type soundness?
questions.explanation: Type soundness is proven through progress (well-typed terms can take a step) and preservation (typing is preserved after steps).

options: Polymorphism through overloading or type classes
questions.explanation: Ad-hoc polymorphism provides different implementations for different types through overloading or type classes.

options: A type parameter not used in the data structure but provides compile-time information
questions.explanation: Phantom types are type parameters that don't appear in the data structure but carry compile-time information.

questions.prompt: What problem does the Option/Maybe type solve?
questions.explanation: Option/Maybe types make absence of values explicit in the type system, eliminating null pointer exceptions.
